section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 19. Injury, Poisoning, and Certain Other Consequences of External Causes > e. Adverse Effects, Poisoning, Underdosing and Toxic Effects > 2. Use as many codes as necessary to describe

content.full_text: Use as many codes as necessary to describe completely all drugs, medicinal or biological substances. (Evidence: pg no: 82, L37-L38)
content.summary: Instruction to assign multiple codes as needed to fully document all drugs, medicinal agents, or biological substances involved in adverse effects, poisoning, or underdosing (Evidence: pg no: 82, L37-L38)
key_concepts: Multiple code assignment requirement (Evidence: pg no: 82, L37)
Complete description mandate (Evidence: pg no: 82, L37-L38)
All substances documentation (Evidence: pg no: 82, L38)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use as many codes as necessary to describe completely all drugs, medicinal or biological substances (Evidence: pg no: 82, L37-L38)
detailed_rules.explanation: When multiple substances are involved in an adverse effect, poisoning, underdosing, or toxic effect, each substance should be coded separately to provide complete documentation (Evidence: pg no: 82, L37-L38)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify all drugs, medicinal, or biological substances involved
Step 2: Determine the effect/condition for each substance
Step 3: Assign appropriate code for each substance
Step 4: Verify complete documentation of all substances
Step 5: Ensure no substances are omitted from coding
